title: Basic Import
description: Import the math module and use it to print the value of pi.

title: Import Specific Function
description: Import only sqrt from math module and calculate sqrt of 16.

title: Import Multiple Functions
description: Import sqrt and pow from math, then print sqrt(25) and pow(2, 3).
hints: Use from math import sqrt, pow

title: Import with Alias
description: Import math as m and use the alias to print pi.
hints: Access with m.pi instead of math.pi

title: Import Function with Alias
description: Import sqrt as square_root and calculate square_root(9).
hints: Use from math import sqrt as square_root

title: Random Integer
description: Import random module and generate a random integer between 1 and 10 (inclusive). Print type check.

title: Random Choice
description: Import choice from random and pick random element from ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry'].
testCode:
{user_code}
fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry']
result = choice(fruits)
print(result in fruits)

title: Current Date
description: Import datetime and print today's date (just the date part, not time).

title: Time Module
description: Import time and get current timestamp (time.time()). Verify it's a float.

title: Get Current Directory
description: Import os and print the current working directory.

title: Python Version
description: Import sys and check that sys.version is a string.

title: JSON Dumps
description: Import json and convert dict {'name': 'Alice', 'age': 30} to JSON string.

title: JSON Loads
description: Import json and parse JSON string '{"x": 10}' to dict. Print the value of 'x'.

title: Counter from Collections
description: Import Counter from collections and count characters in 'hello'. Print the count.

title: DefaultDict
description: Import defaultdict from collections with int default. Set key 'a' and print default value of 'b'.
hints: Missing keys return int() which is 0

title: Itertools Chain
description: Import chain from itertools and flatten [1,2] and [3,4] into single list.

title: Regular Expression Match
description: Import re and check if 'hello' contains pattern 'ell'. Print True or False.

title: Calculate Mean
description: Import statistics and calculate mean of [1, 2, 3, 4, 5].

title: Pathlib Path
description: Import Path from pathlib and create path '/home/user/file.txt'. Print the filename.

title: Deep Copy
description: Import deepcopy from copy and create deep copy of [[1,2], [3,4]]. Verify it's different object.
testCode:
{user_code}
original = [[1, 2], [3, 4]]
copied = deepcopy(original)
print(copied == original and copied is not original)

title: Import All (Wildcard)
description: Import all from math using * and use sqrt function directly. Print sqrt(4).
hints: Not recommended in production but useful to know

title: Create Simple Module
description: Create file 'mymath.py' with function add(a, b). Import and use it to add 3 and 5.
testCode:
with open('mymath.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('def add(a, b):\n    return a + b')
{user_code}
print(mymath.add(3, 5))

title: Import from Custom Module
description: Create 'calculator.py' with multiply(a, b). Import just multiply and use it for 4 * 7.
testCode:
with open('calculator.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('def multiply(a, b):\n    return a * b')
{user_code}
print(multiply(4, 7))

title: Import Module Variable
description: Create 'config.py' with VERSION = '1.0'. Import and print config.VERSION.
testCode:
with open('config.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('VERSION = "1.0"')
{user_code}
print(config.VERSION)
hints: Variables in modules work like functions

title: Module __name__ Check
description: Create module that prints 'Running' only when executed directly, not when imported.
testCode:
with open('testmodule.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('if __name__ == "__main__":\n    print("Running")\nelse:\n    print("Imported")')
{user_code}
import testmodule
hints: Code in this block only runs when script is executed directly

title: List Module Contents
description: Import math and check if 'sqrt' is in dir(math). Print True or False.

title: Module Documentation
description: Import math and verify math.__doc__ is not None.

title: Reload Module
description: Import importlib, create module, import it, modify it, then reload. Show value changes.
testCode:
with open('dynamic.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('value = 1')
{user_code}
import dynamic
print(dynamic.value)
with open('dynamic.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('value = 2')
import importlib
importlib.reload(dynamic)
print(dynamic.value)

title: Create Simple Package
description: Create package 'mypackage' with __init__.py and module 'utils.py'. Import utils.greet().
testCode:
import os
os.makedirs('mypackage', exist_ok=True)
with open('mypackage/__init__.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('')
with open('mypackage/utils.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('def greet():\n    return "Hello"')
{user_code}
print(result)

title: Relative Import
description: Create package with two modules where one imports from the other using relative import.
testCode:
import os
os.makedirs('pkg', exist_ok=True)
with open('pkg/__init__.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('')
with open('pkg/a.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('value = "Success"')
with open('pkg/b.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('from .a import value')
{user_code}
from pkg.b import value
print(value)

title: Modify sys.path
description: Add a custom directory to sys.path and import module from it.
testCode:
import os
os.makedirs('custom_dir', exist_ok=True)
with open('custom_dir/custom.py', 'w') as f:
    f.write('message = "Custom"')
{user_code}
import sys
sys.path.insert(0, 'custom_dir')
import custom
print(custom.message)
hints: sys.path is list of module search paths

title: Avoid Circular Import
description: Demonstrate circular import problem: module A imports B, B imports A. Show error handling.
hints: Solution: import inside function, or restructure

title: Lazy Import
description: Import module inside function instead of top level to demonstrate lazy loading.
hints: Module imported only when function called

title: Import Type Hints
description: Import List from typing and create type-hinted function that takes List[int].

title: Decimal Module
description: Import Decimal from decimal and add 0.1 + 0.2 precisely. Compare with float.

title: Fractions Module
description: Import Fraction from fractions and create fraction 1/3 + 1/6. Print result.

title: Abstract Base Class
description: Import ABC and abstractmethod from abc. Create abstract class with abstract method.
hints: Use from abc import ABC, abstractmethod

title: Enum Module
description: Import Enum from enum and create Color enum with RED=1, GREEN=2, BLUE=3.

title: Dataclass
description: Import dataclass from dataclasses and create Person class with name and age fields.

title: Functools LRU Cache
description: Import lru_cache from functools and create cached fibonacci function.

title: Warnings Module
description: Import warnings and issue a deprecation warning.

title: Import Unittest
description: Import unittest and verify unittest.TestCase exists.

title: Import Argparse
description: Import ArgumentParser from argparse and create a parser object.

title: Subprocess Module
description: Import subprocess and verify the module has 'run' function.

title: Platform Information
description: Import platform and check that platform.system() returns a string.

title: Getpass Module
description: Import getpass and verify getuser function exists.

title: CSV Module
description: Import csv module and verify it has 'reader' and 'writer' attributes.

title: Urllib Module
description: Import urlparse from urllib.parse and parse 'https://example.com/path'.
